Processors¶

Postfix SASL¶

$ loganom postfix-sasl

It checks accounts authentication through postfix sasl.

Usually when an account is compromised, attackers use several machines from their botnets to send emails (spam/virus/phishing/etc) with that credential.

This can be observed when a user that usually connects from the same country, suddenly send emails from all around the world.

IP addresses can be ignored, based on a list of name patterns (dns reverse name) or based on it’s ASN, with the config options pattern_org and pattern_ip.

Can be also used the option country_ignore, which will ignore IP addresses from these countries.

This processor needs an ipinfo.io api token.

See more in Configuration (General section).

Quota High¶

$ loganom quota-high

It checks email accounts that had their email messages rejected because of rate limit.

Usually used with PolicyD service.

Example of reject message:

Jun 19 09:04:26 mail-server postfix/smtpd[14222]: NOQUEUE:
reject: RCPT from host[X.X.X.X]: 554 5.7.1 <anotheruser@domain.com>:
Recipient address rejected: Quota per hour exceeded;
from=<user@domain.com> to=<anotheruser@domain.com> proto=ESMTP helo=<ABCD-IR123AB>

If the number of these reject messages from the same sender became too high (default 150), it is considered an anomaly.

The number of rejecting messages and the reject message itself can be customized, see more in Usage section.

loganom
